records.location_details: Four migrants were apprehended by Frontex and Lithuanian border guards after crossing from Belarus to Lithuania, and subsequently redirected to Belarus.

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman and degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: art. 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights
Article 4 of Protocol 4 to the European Convention on Human Rights
art. 18 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights
art. 19 (2) of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights

records.context_note: Lithuanian authorities explain that Decision No. 42 of 2 August 2021, adopted under a state-level emergency, restricts entry to functioning international border crossing points. The FRO observes that while Article 15 ECHR allows derogations, it does not justify denying effective access to asylum or non-refoulement. Access to designated points appears neither genuine nor effective in practice, and no individual vulnerability assessment was conducted before returning migrants to Belarus, despite reports of mistreatment by Belarusian authorities. The FRO recommends administrative closure but notes the events may amount to serious breaches of fundamental rights.
records.evidence_quote: On 13 March, four Afghans migrants apprehended were returned to Belarus in application of Decision No. 42 of 2 August 2021
